instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message:
Hi guys,


This one plays sound for 1sec and stops. If you wait a while it will play for another second and stop again... I already replaced the audio codec but the problem remains. I focused on the audio codec since there are more than one amps and I thought that it can't be all of them failing.. (unless they have something common as a voltage rail?)

any ideas?

george

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message: Have you checked the headphone jack?

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="arash, post: 3818"]Have you checked the headphone jack?[/QUOTE]


check it for shorting you mean? or if it works? I will do today and let you know..

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message: Yes please check if it switches to optical(look into the port, if the red optical lamp is on). sometimes that is it.

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message:
so it has the same behaviour with headphones.. the sound comes up for half a sec and then stops.. if you wait a while it can work again for another half-second..

there is no light shining from the port indicating a working optical SPDIF output...

any ideas?

threads.title: 820-3462 sound works for 1sec then stops.
threads.message: Check power to codec and 4.5V from U6200. Also check around Q2620 see if that circuit is working ok.
